book.book_title: THE LETTER OF PAUL TO THE COLOSSIANS
book.title: Greeting
Thanksgiving for the Colossian Believers
Prayer for Maturity Based on Christ's Preeminence
Paul's Suffering and Stewardship
book.note: Some manuscripts have "he has reconciled you"
Lit. "man," used here in a generic sense to refer to persons of either gender
book.title: Christ, the Mystery of God
Made Alive in Christ
book.note: Lit. "anyone be the one who takes captive you"
book.title: Do Not Be Judged by Human Religious Rules
Seek the Things Above
Put Off the Old Behavior

line.word: what_is_earthly_in_you:13 τὰ μέλη τὰ ἐπὶ τῆς γῆς

book.note: Or "among them" (the pronoun may refer either to people or to sins)
book.title: Appeal for New Behavior
Mutual Responsibilities in Christian Relationships
Further Advice for the Christian Life
Exhortations Regarding Fellow Workers
Final Greeting and Benediction
book.note: Some manuscripts, including the majority of Byzantine minuscules, read the masculine form of the pronoun here ("his"), understanding the form of the name "Nympha" earlier in the verse to be masculine
